required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: EYESHOT (EmploYEd Antithrombotic Therapies in Patients With Acute Coronary Syndromes HOspitalized in iTalian Coronary Care Units)
clinical_study.official_title: EmploYEd Antithrombotic Therapies in Patients With Acute Coronary Syndromes HOspitalized in iTalian CCUs Registry

brief_summary.textblock: This register will evaluate the use of different antithrombotic therapies, combinations of different drugs routinely used during any stage of hospital admission, with their timing, dosage and mode of administration, in patients with a diagnosis of Acute Coronary Syndrome in the Italian Coronary Care Unit during a study period of three weeks

primary_outcome.measure: Antithrombotic drugs in patient undergoing percutaneous transluminal coronary angiography, coronary artery bypass graft or no coronary revascularization
primary_outcome.time_frame: Participants will be followed for the duration of hospital stay, an expected average period of 7 days

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Participants will be followed for the duration of hospital stay, an expected average period of 7 days

study_pop.textblock: Patients with a diagnosis of Acute Coronary Syndrome consecutively admitted in the Italian Cardiac Care Unit, located in hospitals with and without cardiac cath lab and cardiac surgery, during a period of 3 weeks

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion criteria:
- All consecutive patients discharged with a diagnosis of Acute Coronary Syndrome ( Non ST elevation or ST Elevation) undergoing myocardial revascularization or conservative treatment , admitted to the Coronary Care Unit during the observation period established.
- Age â‰¥ 18 years
- Signed informed consent
Exclusion criteria:
- Patients enrolled in clinical trials of intervention
- Diagnosis of Acute Coronary Syndrome caused by confounding comorbidities (eg . Trauma or surgery after non- cardiac )
- Patients already enrolled in eyeshot from another center.
